pullrequest.title: Disable tests compilation by default in cmake

content.raw:
We currently support the build of individual tests so this change will remove the `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` variable (I'm for it if possible) at the cost of not being able to separate the compilation and run target in make (`make tests` will do both). I don't think that is currently critical not to have the run and compilation of tests separately but I see some use cases where it could be in a CI environment (track time spent in compilation vs time spent in running tests, have different machines for compilation and execution of tests, ...).

Update: just notice the value of having all the tests target generated without the need of running cmake again. This is useful.
